org.jawin
Class COMPtr

java.lang.Object
  org.jawin.COMPtr
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUnknown
Direct Known Subclasses:
DispatchPtr, IEnumVariant, UnknownPtr
public abstract class COMPtr
extends java.lang.Object
implements IUnknown

The base class for all COM vtable or dispatch based interfaces. There are certain rules that must be followed to extend this class successfully:

  • The class MUST have a public no-arg constructor.
  • The class MUST register its Interface Identifier (IID) in Jawin. The following is the standard way to do this (replace the GUID value with the relevant): 
     public static final GUID IID = new GUID("{6EFEB125-55E2-4D6D-A17A-A2F038A647B2}");
 public static final int IID_TOKEN;
 static {
 	IID_TOKEN = IdentityManager.registerProxy(IID, <CLASS>.class);
 }
  • The class MUST implement the abstract method getIIDToken() to return the registered token for the Interface Identifier. The following is the standard way to do this: 
     public int getIIDToken() {
 	return IID_TOKEN;
 }
  • For easy access to the interface it is suggested to implement the following constructors besides the no-arg constructor:
    • For creating a new COM-object with the given progid and with a SomeClass interface: 
       public SomeClass(String progid) throws COMException {
	super(progid, IID);
 }
    • For creating a new COM-object with the given CLSID and with a SomeClass interface: 
       public SomeClass(GUID clsid) throws COMException {
	super(clsid, IID);
 }
    • For getting the SomeClass interface on an existing COM-object. This is an alternative to calling queryInterface(Class) on the existing COM-object: 
       public SomeClass(COMPtr comObject) throws COMException {
 	super(comObject);
 }
Note: Dispatch based interfaces should use DispatchPtr as base class instead of this class.

FIXME - the synchronized stuff in this class should be fixed/aligned.

Constructor Detail

COMPtr

protected COMPtr()
for constructing a COMPtr where neither the GIT cookie or the vtable pointer has been initialized.

COMPtr

protected COMPtr(int peer,
                 int unknown)
for constructing a COMPtr, initializing the GIT cookie or the vtable pointer at construction time. Only one of the parameters should be != 0.

Only the IdentityManager creates COMPtrs ? - FIXME what?

Parameters:
peer - the GIT cookie. Should be set if Jawin should handle threading issues automatically. If this is not wanted it should be set to 0.
unknown - a raw vtable pointer. If set, a COMPtr that can ONLY be called from this thread is created. If this is set to 0, the GIT cookie must be set.

Method Detail

stealUnknown

public void stealUnknown(COMPtr src)
Steal the native unknown pointer from another COMPtr. This should only be used inside the marshalling layer when manipulating temporaries. This can be seen as a "move" opposed to the "copy" in copyUnknown(COMPtr). WARNING: Does NOT increase the reference count for this COMPtr.

Parameters:
src - the COMPtr to steal the unknown pointer from. After this the src COMPtr will have an unset unknown pointer (ie. 0).
See Also:
copyUnknown(COMPtr)

copyUnknown

protected void copyUnknown(COMPtr src)
copy the native unknown pointer from another COMPtr. Increases the reference count for this COMPtr by calling AddRef.

Parameters:
src - the COMPtr to copy the unknown pointer from. The src COMPtr is not modified.
See Also:
stealUnknown(COMPtr)

comInvoke

public byte[] comInvoke(int vtable,
                        java.lang.String instructions,
                        int stackSize,
                        int argStreamSize,
                        byte[] argStream,
                        java.lang.Object[] objectArgs)
                 throws COMException
generic method for calling vtable (virtual function table) based methods on the COM object. If the caller is using a NakedByteStream for building the stack-bytes, the comInvoke(int, String, int, NakedByteStream, Object[]) shortcut method is prefered.

Parameters:
vtable - the index of the requested method in the vtable for this COM object. FIXME - point to resource describing how to find vtable indexes (the Jawin Type Browser seems to show them as vtableoffset?).
instructions - the marshalling instructions for marshalling both the stack-array onto the native stack (this is the [in]-parameters) and marshalling the [return] and [out]-parameters onto the returned byte array. Is on the form xx:y:zz, where xx is for the [in]-marshalling, y is for the [return]-marshalling (this should always be H for HRESULT for COM calls), and zz is for any [out]-marshalling if present. See the Jawin documentation for more about the instruction-strings.
stackSize - the size of the call stack on the native side that the content of the argStream-array should be marshalled to.
argStreamSize - the number of relevant bytes in the argStream-array (often a NakedByteStream is used for the argStream-array, in which case the array will not be full.
argStream - the bytes that should be marshalled to the stack on the native side. The length of this array can NOT be smaller than argStreamSize.
objectArgs - [in/out] used if any java-object should be passed back and forth into the native code.
Returns:
the [return] and [out] parameters from the native call, serialized following the marshalling-instructions given the second and third part of the instructions string.
Throws:
COMException - if the native method failed.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if argStreamSize is bigger than the length of the argStream-array.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this COMPtr has been closed or has never been initialized correctly (that is both peer and unknown == 0).

comInvoke

public byte[] comInvoke(int vtable,
                        java.lang.String instructions,
                        int stackSize,
                        NakedByteStream argStream,
                        java.lang.Object[] objectArgs)
                 throws COMException
shortcut method for calling comInvoke(int, String, int, int, byte[], Object[]) when using a NakedByteStream for building the argStream-bytes.

Parameters:
argStream - the NakedByteStream containing the argStream-bytes. Null is equal to an empty argStream.
Throws:
COMException
See Also:
comInvoke(int, String, int, int, byte[], Object[])

public java.lang.String toString()

getPeer

public int getPeer()
Description copied from interface: IUnknown
should return the GIT cookie if any for this IUnknown. If the returned value is 0, this IUnknown interface is not threadsafe. If the unknown pointer is set, the GIT cookie is not used.

Specified by:
getPeer in interface IUnknown
See Also:
IUnknown.getUnknown()

getUnknown

public int getUnknown()
Description copied from interface: IUnknown
should return the raw vtable pointer for this IUnknown. If this is set this IUnknown can not be used from different threads. If this is 0, the GIT cookie should be set.

Specified by:
getUnknown in interface IUnknown
See Also:
IUnknown.getPeer()

queryInterface

public IUnknown queryInterface(java.lang.Class newItf)
                        throws COMException
Description copied from interface: IUnknown
return another interface on this object. The returned interface is NOT threadsafe. To get a threadsafe interface, use IUnknown.queryGITInterface(Class).

Specified by:
queryInterface in interface IUnknown
Parameters:
newItf - must be a subclass of COMPtr.
Returns:
the requested interface - the caller should cast it down to the requested type.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this COMPtr has been closed or has never been initialized correctly (that is both peer and unknown == 0).
COMException - if the requested interface is not supported on this object.

queryGITInterface

public IUnknown queryGITInterface(java.lang.Class newItf)
                           throws COMException
Description copied from interface: IUnknown
return a threadsafe interface on this object.

Important: note that invoking native methods on such a threadsafe object is a factor 5-20 times slower per call than using a non-threadsafe object.

Specified by:
queryGITInterface in interface IUnknown
Parameters:
newItf - must be a subclass of COMPtr.
Returns:
the requested interface - the caller should cast it down to the requested type.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this COMPtr has been closed or has never been initialized correctly (that is both peer and unknown == 0).
COMException - if the requested interface is not supported on this object.

createDirectRef

public IUnknown createDirectRef()
                         throws COMException
Description copied from interface: IUnknown
return a new interface object that can ONLY be used on this thread. The interface is of the same type as the object this method is called on.

Specified by:
createDirectRef in interface IUnknown
Returns:
a new non-threadsafe object - the caller should cast it down to the requested type.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this COMPtr has been closed or has never been initialized correctly (that is both peer and unknown == 0).
COMException - if unable to create a non-threadsafe object.
See Also:
IUnknown.queryInterface(Class)

createGITRef

public IUnknown createGITRef()
                      throws COMException
Description copied from interface: IUnknown
return a new threadsafe object, that is an interface on this object. The interface is of the same type as the object this method is called on.

Important: note that invoking native methods on such a threadsafe object is a factor 5-20 times slower per call than using a non-threadsafe object.

Specified by:
createGITRef in interface IUnknown
Returns:
a new threadsafe object - the caller should cast it down to the requested type.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this COMPtr has been closed or has never been initialized correctly (that is both peer and unknown == 0).
COMException - if unable to create a threadsafe object for this interface.
See Also:
IUnknown.queryGITInterface(Class)

finalize

protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
finalize method that calls close() as a fallback on garbage collection time. Please notice that this fallback will not always work, since it is unspecified what thread the finalizer will called on.

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

close

public void close()
           throws COMException
Should be called when finished using this COMPtr. Decreases the reference-counts to either the GIT-cookie or the vtable interface pointer.

Important: This should be called on the same thread as this object is created on (this is not guarenteed for the finalize() method, which can lead to leaks).

Specified by:
close in interface IUnknown
Throws:
COMException
